title: Utley suspension, Ian Desmond's take & other musings
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Utley suspension, Ian Desmond's take & other musings First, here's a look at a tweet from long-time and not very much longer Nationals player, Ian Desmond on Chase Utley's suspension. Post to Facebook Utley suspension, Ian Desmond's take & other musings First, here's a look at a tweet from long-time and not very much longer Nationals player, Ian Desmond on Chase Utley's suspension.   WUSA9.com: http://on.wusa9.com/1RFtooP   Join the Conversation To   Utley suspension, Ian Desmond's take & other musings Utley suspension, Ian Desmond's take & other musings Holden Kushner 2:37 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 during game three of the National League Division Series at Citi Field on October 12, 2015 in New York City. (Photo: Elsa) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON (WUSA9) -- First, here's a look at a tweet from long-time and not very much longer Nationals player, Ian Desmond on Chase Utley's suspension. Clean or dirty doesn't matter at this point. Dodgers not giving the runs back. Chase will gladly take repercussions. — Ian Desmond (@IDesmond20) October 11, 2015 
Another current player, outfielder Justin Upton also reacted to the suspension of Utley. If that was a superstar shortstop we would have a Tulo Rule being enforced tomorrow — Justin Upton (@JUST_JUP) October 11, 2015 
Hall of Famer, Craig Biggio has a completely opposite opinion on the slide. 
"It's like everytime somebody gets hurt we're changing the rules... if you don't slide the right way, usually your pitcher will take care of that," Biggio said. 
The opinionated Chipper Jones also gave his two cents. That was not a slide and that is not how u 'go in hard'! — Chipper Jones (@RealCJ10) October 11, 2015 
And lastly, here's Bryce Harper with Silver hair A photo posted by @squaresalonlv on Oct 10, 2015 at 1:19pm PDT Read or Share this story: http://on.wusa9.com/1RFtooP TOP VIDEOS
